scenarios.title: The College Decision
scenarios.description: You've been accepted to multiple colleges. One is prestigious but far from home with a demanding program. Another is local, affordable, with a supportive community. A third offers a unique experimental program aligned with your unconventional interests.

choices.title: Choose the prestigious university
choices.description: High pressure but excellent career prospects
choices.outcome: You thrive under pressure, building an impressive network. The workload is intense, and you sometimes wonder about the paths not taken.

choices.title: Stay close to home
choices.description: Maintain your support network and save money
choices.outcome: You build deep roots in your community. The familiar environment provides stability, though part of you wonders about distant horizons.

choices.title: Try the experimental program
choices.description: Unconventional path with uncertain outcomes
choices.outcome: The program challenges your assumptions about education. You develop unique skills, though explaining your path to others proves challenging.

reflection_prompts: What pressures influenced your educational choices at that age?
How much of this decision was yours versus others' expectations?

scenarios.title: First Job Crossroads
scenarios.description: You've graduated and face your first major career decision. A stable corporate job offers good pay and clear advancement. A startup opportunity is exciting but risky. You could also take time to travel or pursue further education.

choices.title: Take the corporate position
choices.description: Stability, benefits, and a clear career ladder
choices.outcome: The structure provides security. You learn professional norms and build savings, though creative impulses sometimes feel constrained.

choices.title: Join the startup
choices.description: High risk, high potential reward
choices.outcome: The chaos is exhilarating. You wear many hats and grow rapidly, though the uncertainty keeps you up some nights.

choices.title: Take a gap year
choices.description: Travel, explore, figure things out
choices.outcome: The experiences broaden your perspective immensely. Returning to 'normal life' feels different, and you see paths others don't.

reflection_prompts: What did 'success' mean to you at this stage?
Whose definition of a good career were you following?

scenarios.title: Love and Distance
scenarios.description: You're in a meaningful relationship when your partner receives an opportunity in another city. They ask you to come with them. Your own career is just gaining momentum where you are.

choices.title: Move with your partner
choices.description: Prioritize the relationship over career
choices.outcome: Starting fresh together strengthens your bond. Building a new career takes time, but the relationship grows deeper.

choices.title: Try long distance
choices.description: Maintain both the relationship and your path
choices.outcome: The distance tests you both. Some couples grow stronger; others drift apart. The uncertainty is constant.

choices.title: End the relationship
choices.description: Acknowledge different life directions
choices.outcome: The grief is real, but so is the freedom. You dive into your work and personal growth, wondering sometimes about what might have been.

reflection_prompts: How do you balance personal ambition with commitment to others?
What fears influenced this kind of decision?

scenarios.title: The Promotion Dilemma
scenarios.description: You're offered a significant promotion. It means more money and status, but also longer hours, more stress, and managing people you currently consider friends.

choices.title: Accept the promotion
choices.description: Embrace the opportunity and its demands
choices.outcome: Leadership suits you in some ways, challenges you in others. The relationships with former peers shift, sometimes painfully.

choices.title: Negotiate different terms
choices.description: Try to reshape the role to fit your values
choices.outcome: The negotiation reveals what matters to you. Whether successful or not, you've defined your boundaries.

choices.title: Decline the promotion
choices.description: Preserve your current balance and relationships
choices.outcome: Others are surprised. You keep what matters to you, though questions about ambition linger. Peace has its own value.

reflection_prompts: What does success mean beyond external markers?
How do power dynamics affect your relationships?

scenarios.title: The Parenting Question
scenarios.description: The question of children becomes unavoidable. Your partner has clear feelings one way. Family and society have expectations. Your own feelings are... complicated.

choices.title: Decide to have children
choices.description: Embrace parenthood with its transformation
choices.outcome: Nothing prepares you for this change. Identity, priorities, everything shifts. The love is profound; so is the exhaustion.

choices.title: Choose to be child-free
choices.description: Define family and purpose differently
choices.outcome: You build a life rich in other ways. Some relationships shift as peers become parents. Freedom takes many forms.

choices.title: Postpone the decision
choices.description: Not ready to commit either way
choices.outcome: Time passes. The window shifts but doesn't close immediately. The ongoing uncertainty is its own weight.

reflection_prompts: Whose voice was loudest in this decision?
What fears or hopes drove your thinking about family?

scenarios.title: The Wake-Up Call
scenarios.description: A health scare—yours or someone close to you—forces a confrontation with mortality and lifestyle. The doctors recommend significant changes. Your current life is built around habits that now seem risky.

choices.title: Commit to major lifestyle change
choices.description: Restructure your life around health
choices.outcome: The transformation is difficult but real. Old pleasures give way to new ones. Some relationships don't survive the change.

choices.title: Make moderate adjustments
choices.description: Balance health with quality of life
choices.outcome: You find a middle path. Progress is slower but sustainable. The fear fades; hopefully the habits remain.

choices.title: Struggle to change
choices.description: Old patterns are hard to break
choices.outcome: You try, fail, try again. Change is harder than willpower. Shame and fear compete with comfort and habit.

reflection_prompts: What relationship do you have with your body and its limits?
How does mortality shape your choices?

scenarios.title: The Burnout Crossroads
scenarios.description: Success came, but at a cost. You're exhausted, disconnected from what once motivated you. Something has to change, but your responsibilities and identity are tied to this path.

choices.title: Make a radical career change
choices.description: Start over in a new field
choices.outcome: The leap is terrifying and liberating. Starting over at this stage brings humility and unexpected growth.

choices.title: Take an extended break
choices.description: Rest and reflect before deciding
choices.outcome: Time away reveals things hidden by busyness. Clarity comes slowly, but it comes. Re-entry is its own challenge.

choices.title: Push through and adapt
choices.description: Find ways to cope within current path
choices.outcome: You find small adjustments that help. The underlying issues remain, managed if not solved. Resilience has limits.

reflection_prompts: What signals of exhaustion did you ignore, and why?
What would 'enough' look like for you?

scenarios.title: The Authentic Self
scenarios.description: You've been hiding or suppressing a core part of yourself—your beliefs, orientation, values, or true aspirations. The cost of hiding grows heavier. But revealing yourself risks relationships and stability.

choices.title: Live authentically and openly
choices.description: Accept the consequences of truth
choices.outcome: Some relationships deepen; others break. The relief of authenticity competes with grief over losses. You become more yourself.

choices.title: Reveal selectively to safe people
choices.description: Build a support system gradually
choices.outcome: You find your people, one by one. Living in two worlds is exhausting but feels safer. Boundaries become crucial.

choices.title: Continue concealing for now
choices.description: Protect stability and relationships
choices.outcome: External life remains stable. Internal life grows heavier. The question doesn't go away—it just waits.

reflection_prompts: What parts of yourself have you hidden, and at what cost?
What would safety look like for your true self?

scenarios.title: The Caregiver's Burden
scenarios.description: An aging parent needs significant care. Siblings disagree about responsibility. Your own life—career, family, health—already feels stretched. Cultural and personal expectations weigh heavily.

choices.title: Become the primary caregiver
choices.description: Sacrifice your own priorities for family duty
choices.outcome: The bond with your parent deepens. Your other relationships and goals suffer. Resentment and love coexist uncomfortably.

choices.title: Insist on shared responsibility
choices.description: Set boundaries while still contributing
choices.outcome: Family tensions rise before they settle. Not everyone is happy, but the system is more sustainable. Guilt visits sometimes.

choices.title: Arrange professional care
choices.description: Provide support differently than expected
choices.outcome: The practical solution meets resistance. Cultural expectations clash with reality. You question your own values and limits.

reflection_prompts: What obligations do we have to those who raised us?
How do you balance self-care with care for others?

scenarios.title: The Meaning Crisis
scenarios.description: You've achieved much of what you set out to do—or haven't, and time is running out. Either way, a profound question emerges: what has it all meant? What matters in the time remaining?

choices.title: Pursue a meaningful legacy project
choices.description: Create something that outlasts you
choices.outcome: Purpose returns with new urgency. The project may succeed or fail—the meaning comes from the pursuit itself.

choices.title: Invest deeply in relationships
choices.description: Find meaning in connection, not achievement
choices.outcome: You repair some bridges, deepen others. Achievement fades; presence remains. Not everyone understands the shift.

choices.title: Practice acceptance of what is
choices.description: Let go of striving for meaning
choices.outcome: The struggle for meaning softens. What remains is simpler, quieter. Peace comes not from answers but from releasing questions.

reflection_prompts: What would you want to be remembered for?
How has your definition of success evolved?

scenarios.title: Profound Loss
scenarios.description: Someone central to your life is gone—through death, abandonment, or irreversible circumstance. The world continues, but you've been fundamentally altered. How do you carry this?

choices.title: Lean into community and support
choices.description: Let others help carry the weight
choices.outcome: Grief shared is grief transformed, not erased. You learn to receive care. The loss remains; the isolation doesn't.

choices.title: Process privately and internally
choices.description: Grieve in your own way and time
choices.outcome: You develop your own relationship with loss. Others may not understand your timeline. Healing happens invisibly.

choices.title: Channel grief into action
choices.description: Transform pain into purpose
choices.outcome: The energy of grief becomes fuel. You create something meaningful from destruction. The pain persists but has somewhere to go.

reflection_prompts: How has loss shaped who you've become?
What did this loss teach you about what matters?

scenarios.title: Economic Upheaval
scenarios.description: External forces beyond your control have upended your financial stability. Job loss, market collapse, or industry disruption—the security you built is suddenly gone.

choices.title: Reinvent yourself professionally
choices.description: Use crisis as catalyst for change
choices.outcome: The forced change opens unexpected doors. Skills transfer in surprising ways. The crisis becomes a pivot point.

choices.title: Persist in your field despite hardship
choices.description: Wait out the storm in familiar territory
choices.outcome: You endure what others couldn't. The recovery is slow but you emerge with field intact. Scars remain.

choices.title: Prioritize immediate security
choices.description: Take any available stability
choices.outcome: You survive. Dreams defer but don't die. Stability returns slowly. The experience changes your relationship with security.

reflection_prompts: What did financial insecurity reveal about your values?
How did external circumstances shape what felt possible?

trajectory_descriptions.achievement-focused: Driven by accomplishment and external markers of success
trajectory_descriptions.exploratory: Drawn to novelty, change, and new experiences
trajectory_descriptions.relationship-focused: Prioritizes connection and care for others
trajectory_descriptions.caregiver: Finds meaning in nurturing and supporting others
trajectory_descriptions.unconventional: Charts a path outside traditional expectations
trajectory_descriptions.authentic: Committed to living true to inner values
trajectory_descriptions.contemplative: Oriented toward reflection and inner life
